intro: Scyphogyne fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered scyphogyne, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Scyphogyne fasciculata is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
